com.ansca.corona
Class CoronaLua

java.lang.Object
  com.ansca.corona.CoronaLua

public class CoronaLua
extends java.lang.Object

Set of convenience functions for use with the LuaState.

You should call these methods inside a CoronaRuntimeTask to ensure that modifications to the Lua state happen on the Corona thread.

normalize

public static int normalize(LuaState L,

newRef

public static int newRef(LuaState L,
                         int index)
Creates a Java-side reference to a Lua value. Typically you use this when you want to store a reference to a Lua listener.

Returns:
Returns a reference identifier

deleteRef

public static void deleteRef(LuaState L,
                             int ref)
Release the Java-side reference to a Lua value, which would otherwise prevent the Lua value from being garbage collected.

newEvent

public static void newEvent(LuaState L,
                            java.lang.String eventName)
Pushes an event object to the top of the Lua stack.

dispatchEvent

public static void dispatchEvent(LuaState L,
                                 int listenerRef,
                                 int nresults)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
Dispatches an event. The event should be at the top of the Lua stack. The listenerRef is a reference identifier returned by CoronaLua.newRef.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

isListener

public static boolean isListener(LuaState L,
                                 int index,
                                 java.lang.String eventName)
